titleStmt.title: Good nevves from France. Containing the insolent demands of the Iesuites. Being against 1. The Kings authoritie. 2. The ordinary iustice of his Maiestie. 3. The dignitie and power of the cardinalls, archbishops, and bishops of other orders & professions. 4. The young scholars vnder them. 5. The good and well-fare of the townes and cities which receiue them. 6. The perfection of sciences. 7. The antiquity & co[m]mandements of the Church. 8. The resolution of the clergie of France, and the letters patents of the Kings; and against the sentences of allowance and registring thereof, which they themselues haue pursued. Together with the decree or finall iudgement of the Kings Privie Councell giuen the 27. day of September 1624. in the ioynt defence of the vniversities of France. And against the Iesuites ... / Translated according to the French copie..
titleStmt.author: France. Conseil privé. Arrest du Conseil privé du Roy, donné le 27. de Sept. 1624. pour les Universitéz de France, jointes en cause, contre les Jésuites. English. Selections.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by I[ohn] D[awson] for Iohn Bellamie, and are to be sold at his shop, at the three golden Lyons, neare the Royall Exchange.,

notesStmt.note: The words "1. The Kings authoritie. .. themselues haue pursued." are bracketed together on title page.
Includes a translation of extracts from: Arrest du Conseil privé du Roy, donné le 27. de Sept. 1624. pour les Universitéz de France, jointes en cause, contre les Jésuites.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.

place.placeName: his shop, at the three golden Lyons, neare the Royall Exchange.
